author: Special Correspondent
text: Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Tuesday inaugurated various buildings, unveiled statues of freedom fighters and poets, including a high mast lamp set up near the memorial of former President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam in Rameswaram. Buildings for International Institute of Tamil Studies, Tamil University, statues of freedom fighter Chidambaranathan at Kaliyakkavilai and poet Desiya Vinayagam Pillai at Susindram in Kanyakumari district, anti-Hindi activist Keezhapazhavur Chinnasamy at Kambarasampettai in Tiruchi district and ‘Rebel’ Muthuramalinga Sethupathy at Ramanathapuram were opened by Ms. Jayalalithaa, an official release stated. She also inaugurated the high mast lamp near Kalam's memorial at Rameswaram and a bus shelter nearby constructed at a cost of Rs. 21 lakh. She released the Chinese and Arabian translations of Tamil classic Aathichudi and poems of noted Tamil poet Bharathidasan, it added.
title: New buildings, statues unveiled
